title: Wrong DocBlock annotation in ErrorHandler::register causes static analyses to fail
body:
The signature of the method `ErrorHandler::register()` is this (`v1.23.0`):

```php
    /**
     * Registers a new ErrorHandler for a given Logger
     *
     * By default it will handle errors, exceptions and fatal errors
     *
     * @param  LoggerInterface $logger
     * @param  array|false     $errorLevelMap  an array of E_* constant to LogLevel::* constant mapping, or false to disable error handling
     * @param  int|false       $exceptionLevel a LogLevel::* constant, or false to disable exception handling
     * @param  int|false       $fatalLevel     a LogLevel::* constant, or false to disable fatal error handling
     * @return ErrorHandler
     */
    public static function register(LoggerInterface $logger, $errorLevelMap = array(), $exceptionLevel = null, $fatalLevel = null)
```

It accepts a `LogLevel::*` constant or `null` or `false`.

This causes problems as:

1. `LogLevel::*` constants contain `string`s and not `int`egers;
2. It is possible to pass `null` to use the default `LogLevel::*` constant (`LogLevel::ALERT` for `$fatalLevel` and `LogLevel::ERROR` for `$exceptionLevel` that internally is `$this->uncaughtExceptionLevel`).
3. `int` are never used and so it is impossible to fix by ourselves the issue.

**To fix this: Fix the docblock to cast to `null|string|false`.**

INFO: To statically analyze my code I'm using `Phan` (https://github.com/phan/phan).
